definitions: An English military and political leader who served as Lord Protector of the Commonwealth of England, Scotland, and Ireland from 1653 until his death in 1658.
A key figure in the English Civil War, leading the Parliamentarian forces to victory against King Charles I.
examples: Oliver Cromwell rose to prominence during the English Civil War.
The reign of Oliver Cromwell as Lord Protector was a period of significant change.
Many historical accounts discuss the complex legacy of Oliver Cromwell.
